toyotama.crypto package¶

Submodules¶

toyotama.crypto.aes module¶

toyotama.crypto.aes.ecb_chosen_plaintext_attack(encrypt_oracle: Callable[[bytes], bool], plaintext_space: bytes = b'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789{}_', known_plaintext: bytes = b'', block_size: int = 16, verbose: bool = False)¶

AES ECB mode chosen plaintext attack

This function helps solving chosen plaintext attack.

Parameters

  • encrypt_oracle (typing.Callable[[bytes], bool]) – the encryption oracle.

  • plaintext_space (bytes, optional) – Defaults to uppercase + lowercase + numbers + “{}_”.

  • known_plaintext (bytes, optional) – Defaults to b””.

  • block_size (int, optional) – Defaults to 16.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Defaults to False.

Returns

The plaintext.

Return type

bytes

toyotama.crypto.aes.padding_oracle_attack(ciphertext: bytes, padding_oracle: Callable, iv: bytes = b'', block_size: int = 16, verbose: bool = False) → bytes¶

Padding Oracle Attack solver.

This function helps solving “Padding Oracle Attack”

Parameters

  • ciphertext (bytes) – The ciphertext.

  • padding_oracle (Callable) – The padding oracle function. This function receives ciphertext and returns the ciphertext is valid or not.

  • iv (bytes, optional) – An initialization vector. Defaults to b””.

  • block_size (int, optional) – The block size of AES. Defaults to 16.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Show more information if True, otherwise no output.

Returns

The plaintext

Return type

bytes

  • B (str or bytes) – The second string.

ROTxx

Common Modulus Attack

Common Modulus Attack

Parameters

  • e1 (int) – The first public exponent.

  • e2 (int) – The second public exponent.

  • c1 (int) – The first ciphertext.

  • c1 – The second ciphertext.

Returns

The plaintext

Return type

toyotama.crypto.rsa.lsb_decryption_oracle_attack(N: int, e: int, c: int, oracle: Callable, progress: bool = True)¶

LSB Decryption oracle attack

Parameters

  • N (int) – The modulus.

  • e (int) – The exponent.

  • c (int) – The ciphertext.

  • oracle (Callable) – The decryption oracle. c*2**e = (2*m)**e (mod n) >> oracle >> m&1

Returns

The plaintext

Return type

int

Wiener’s attack

Parameters

  • e (int) – The public exponent.

  • N (int) – The modulus.

Returns

The private key. None if failed.

Return type

int or None

toyotama.crypto.util module¶

Crypto Utility

toyotama.crypto.util.baby_giant(g, y, p, q=None)¶
toyotama.crypto.util.chinese_remainder(A: list, M: list) → tuple¶

Chinese Remainder Theorem A = [a0, a1, a2, a3, …] M = [m0, m1, m2, m3, …] Compute X (mod Y = m0*m1*m2*…) such that these equations

  • x = a0 (mod m0)

  • x = a1 (mod m1)

  • x = a2 (mod m2)

  • x = a3 (mod m3)

  • …

by Garner’s algorithm.

Parameters

  • A (list[int]) – The list of value.

  • M (list[int]) – The list of modulus.

Returns

X, Y such that satisfy the equations

Return type

tuple[int, int]

toyotama.crypto.util.extended_gcd(A: int, B: int) → tuple¶

Extended GCD.

Parameters

  • A (int) – The first value.

  • B (int) – The second value.

Returns

(x, y, g) s.t. Ax + By = gcd(A, B) = g

Return type

tuple[int, int, int]

toyotama.crypto.util.factorize_from_ed(n, d, e=65537)¶
toyotama.crypto.util.factorize_from_kphi(n, kphi)¶

factorize by Miller-Rabin primality test n: p*q kphi: k*phi(n) = k*(p-1)*(q-1)

kphi = 2**r * s
